title: Tom Brady just revealed that his dog Junie is a clone of Lua, his deceased furry friend
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Tom Brady cloned his deceased dog Lua using a blood sample, resulting in his new dog, Junie.
Brady partnered with Colossal Biosciences, which recently acquired Viagen, a leader in animal cloning.
Colossal Biosciences, invested in by Brady, claimed to have genetically engineered wolves resembling the extinct dire wolf.

title: Running unopposed, Michelle Wu secures second term as her national profile grows
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Michelle Wu secures a second term as Boston mayor, running unopposed after opponent Josh Kraft dropped out.
Wu gained national attention testifying to Congress on Boston's sanctuary policies, despite Trump's immigration claims.
During her tenure, Wu introduced fare-free bus lines and a rent stabilization petition, maintaining a 66% favorability rating.

title: Tell us: What should Mayor Wu focus on in her second term?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu runs unopposed for Boston's mayoral election, securing a second term after a decisive preliminary win.
Wu's first term focused on housing, climate resilience, and immigration, though issues like high housing costs still persist.
Residents are invited to suggest Wu's second-term priorities, including housing, climate, public safety, and transit improvements.

title: ‘This is kidnapping — plain and simple’: ICE arrests 9 employees at Allston car wash
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: ICE detained nine employees at an Allston car wash during a raid, despite their possession of work permits.
Manager Jose Barrera stated ICE agents detained employees before allowing them to retrieve documents due to language barriers.
Boston City Councilor Liz Breadon criticized the ICE raid, calling it 'kidnapping' and urged contact with local immigration support organizations.

title: Patriots opt to stand pat at trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots chose not to make any trades at the NFL deadline, maintaining their current 7-2 roster.
New England traded Keion White and Kyle Dugger before the deadline, impacting their defensive depth.
The team faces potential depth challenges due to injuries in the running back and secondary positions.

title: Amid SNAP benefit cuts, these Greater Boston food businesses are here to help
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Greater Boston restaurants offer free meals and discounts amid government shutdown affecting SNAP benefits.
Allandale Farm and local businesses host free produce and food distribution events in response to SNAP delays.
Seoul Kitchen provides free family meals to SNAP recipients and federal workers during the shutdown.

title: Karen Read shuffles defense attorney lineup in wrongful death suit
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Karen Read has replaced her defense team for the wrongful death lawsuit regarding the death of Boston Police Officer John O'Keefe.
Lawyers William Keville, Christopher George, and Marissa Palladini withdrew, while Michael Bell, Thomas Tang, Sarah Shipley, and Arthur Maravelis joined.
The wrongful death suit follows Read's acquittal of murder charges, with O'Keefe's family alleging she fatally struck him with her SUV.

title: FuGaKyu in Brookline closes after 27 years in business
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: FuGaKyu, a Japanese restaurant in Brookline, is closing on November 5, 2025, after 27 years of operation.
The restaurant, known for its sushi and shoji decor, was founded in 1998 in Coolidge Corner by an owner citing personal reasons for closure.
Former diners shared memories and praise for its innovative menu and warm service after the closing was announced on Facebook.

title: Halsey hospitalized with ‘minor medical emergency’ in between Boston shows
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Halsey experienced a minor medical emergency between shows at MGM Music Hall in Boston but is now recovered.
After being treated at Massachusetts General Hospital, Halsey thanked the medical team for their care on Instagram.
Halsey continues her 'Back to Badlands' tour, performing sold-out shows despite past health issues like lupus and endometriosis.

title: 18-year-old killed in Belmont moped crash
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: An 18-year-old Watertown man died after his moped collided with an SUV in Belmont on Tuesday morning.
The moped was driving erratically on Trapelo Road before crashing at the intersection of Stults Road and Fairview Avenue.
Authorities are investigating the crash with help from the District Attorney, Belmont police, and Massachusetts State Police.
